sen.j: 泉皇女（いずみのひめみこ、生年不詳 - 天平6年（734年）2月8日 (旧暦)）は、天智天皇の皇女。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Izumi (year of birth unknown, died February 8, 734 [according to the lunar calendar]) was a daughter of Emperor Tenchi (Tenji).
The Imperial Princess Izumi (year of birth unknown - March 21, 734) was a princess of the Emperor Tenchi (Tenji).
sen.cmt: 天平6年（734年）2月8日 (旧暦)）→西暦734年3月21日と修正しました。カッコ内を修正、daughter→princess と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: The Imperial Princess Izumi (year of birth unknown - March 21, 734) was a princess of the Emperor Tenchi (Tenji).

sen.j: 同母兄姉に大江皇女と川島皇子がいる。
sen.e: She had an elder sister-uterine, Oe no himemiko (Imperial princess Oe), and an elder brother-uterine, Imperial prince Kawashima.
She had an older sister-uterine, Oe no himemiko (the Imperial Princess Oe), and an older brother-uterine, the Imperial Prince Kawashima.
sen.cmt: elder→older, princess→Princess,prince→Prince と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: She had an older sister-uterine, Oe no himemiko (the Imperial Princess Oe), and an older brother-uterine, the Imperial Prince Kawashima.
Saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at the ise shrine)
Saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
sen.cmt: the ise shrine→Ise-jingu Shrine と修正しました。ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: Saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).

sen.j: 大宝 (日本)元年（701年）2月に斎王にト定される。
sen.e: Princess Izumi was selected by divination as Saio (an unmarried female relative of an Japanese emperor, serving at Ise Grand Shrine) in 701.
The Princess Izumi was selected by divination as Saio (an unmarried female relative of an Japanese emperor, serving at Ise Grand Shrine [Ise-jingu Shrine]) in March 701.
sen.cmt: 大宝 (日本)元年（701年）2月→西暦701年3月と修正しました。the, [Ise-jingu Shrine] を補いました。
sen.e: The Princess Izumi was selected by divination as Saio (an unmarried female relative of an Japanese emperor, serving at Ise Grand Shrine [Ise-jingu Shrine]) in March 701.

sen.j: 同2年（702年）1月17日、新しく設けられた斎宮寮長官「斎宮頭」に、従五位下であった当麻真人橘が任命された。
sen.e: On January 17, 702, 当麻真人橘, who held Jugoinoge (junior fifth rank, lower grade), was assigned the role of Saiku no kami (a director of the Bureau of the High Priestess of Ise).
sen.cmt: 当麻真人橘の読みが分かりませんでした。調べたところ、当麻真人が姓で橘が名であると思われます。当麻真人国見が「たいまのまひとくにみ」と読むらしいので、「たいまのまひとたちばな」かもしれませんが、確証はありません。
sen.e: On February 22, 702, 当麻真人橘, who held Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), was assigned the role of Saiku no kami (a director of the Bureau of the High Priestess of Ise).
sen.cmt: 同2年（702年）1月17日→西暦702年2月22日と修正しました。(junior fifth rank, lower grade)→(Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) と修正しました。「当麻真人橘」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: On February 22, 702, 当麻真人橘, who held Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), was assigned the role of Saiku no kami (a director of the Bureau of the High Priestess of Ise).

sen.j: これ以降、斎宮頭には、従五位下に相当する位の官人が任命される事となった。
sen.e: After this assignment, it became customary that a government official who held Jugoinoge was assigned Saiku no kami.
After this assignment, it became customary that a government official who held Jugoinoge was assigned Saiku no kami.
After this assignment, it became customary that a government official who held Jugoinoge was assigned Saiku no kami.

sen.j: 慶雲3年（706年）閏1月28日に泉皇女は伊勢へ下向する。
sen.e: On January 28, 706, Princess Izumi left the capital for Ise Province.
On March 21, 706, the Princess Izumi left the capital for Ise Province.
sen.cmt: 慶雲3年（706年）閏1月28日→西暦706年3月21日と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: On March 21, 706, the Princess Izumi left the capital for Ise Province.

sen.j: 同年の8月5日には、新たに田形皇女が斎王にト定され、泉皇女は退下した。
sen.e: On August 8, 706, Princess Takata was newly selected by divination as Saio, and Princess Izumi retired from the post of Saio.
On September 20, 706, the Princess Takata was newly selected by divination as Saio, and the Princess Izumi retired from the post of Saio.
sen.cmt: 同年の8月5日→西暦706年9月20日と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: On September 20, 706, the Princess Takata was newly selected by divination as Saio, and the Princess Izumi retired from the post of Saio.

sen.j: 霊亀元年（715年）1月11日に帰京後、三品に叙せられていた泉皇女は、100戸、封を加増された。
sen.e: After she returned to Kyoto on January 11, 715, she was conferred Sanbon (third order) and was given the right to collect tax from 100 more families.
After she returned to Kyoto on February 23, 715, she was conferred Sanbon (third rank) and was given the right to collect tax from 100 more families.
sen.cmt: 霊亀元年（715年）1月11日→西暦715年2月23日と修正しました。order→rank と修正しました。
sen.e: After she returned to Kyoto on February 23, 715, she was conferred Sanbon (third rank) and was given the right to collect tax from 100 more families.

sen.j: その後、時期は定かではないものの二品に叙せられた。
sen.e: It's not known exactly when, but later, she was conferred Nihon (second order).
It is not known exactly when, but later, she was conferred Nihon (second rank).
sen.cmt: It's→It is,order→rank と修正しました。
sen.e: It is not known exactly when, but later, she was conferred Nihon (second rank).
She died on February 8, 734.
She died on March 21, 734.
sen.cmt: 天平6年（734年）2月8日→西暦734年3月21日と修正しました。
sen.e: She died on March 21, 734.
